description: A major late Iron Age and Roman religious complex overlooking the River Severn. Cult figures and curse tablets indicate that the primary deity worshipped here was Mercury.
bibliography: Cleary, Simon Esmonde. “The ‘end of the Gods’ in Late Roman Britain,” 2015.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Uley (Gloucestershire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
McCarty, Matthew. “Chapter 4.2, Religious Dedications.” In The Oxford Handbook of Roman Sculpture, 2015.
Smith, Alex. “The Fate of Pagan Temples in South-East Britain.” In Ritual Landsacpes of South-East Britain, edited by David Rudling, 2008.
Woodward, and Leach. The Uley Shrines: Excavation of a Ritual Complex on West Hill, Uley, Gloucestershire, 1993.
